claims.text: Hotline for Complaints About «Loud Ukrainian Refugees» Set Up Lisbon

claimReview.title: Fake: Hotline for Complaints About «Loud Ukrainian Refugees» Set Up Lisbon
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence that such ads were posted in Lisbon.

claims.text: Zelensky Will Force Partners to Pay for Disposing Obsolete Military Equipment They Gave Ukraine

claimReview.title: Fake: Zelensky Will Force Partners to Pay for Disposing Obsolete Military Equipment They Gave Ukraine
claimReview.textualRating: This whole news is made up. Zelensky has never made such statements, and the text itself is full of logical errors.

claims.text: Zelensky Was the Last Who Pope Francis Spoke To — Ukrainian Media

claimReview.title: Fake: Zelensky Was the Last Who Pope Francis Spoke To — Ukrainian Media
claimReview.textualRating: In reality, the Ukrainian media did not report such information, and the «debunking» publication on Politico is fabricated.

claims.text: BBC News chyron naming Valerii Zaluzhnyi as 'Ukraine's next president.'

claimReview.title: No, this isn't a real BBC News broadcast about Valerii Zaluzhny

claims.text: The BBC reported on a foiled attempt by President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s wife Olena to flee Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Russian fake news content targeting Ukraine president's wife spreads online
claimReview.textualRating: False. The news report is fake and is believed to be part of a Russian disinformation campaign.

claims.text: Volodymyr Zelensky Adressed Ukrainians on Easter in English Only

claimReview.title: Fake: Volodymyr Zelensky Adressed Ukrainians on Easter in English Only
claimReview.textualRating: The fragment of the greeting that is being shared online was created specifically for a foreign audience. The president congratulated Ukrainians in state language.

claims.text: Ukraine Covered Up 'Assassination Attempt on US President'

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Covered Up 'Assassination Attempt on US President'
claimReview.textualRating: Ukraine has no connection to the attempted assassination of US President Donald Trump by American citizen Ryan Root. The only link between Root and Ukraine is that he allegedly tried to buy a rocket launcher and a surface-to-air missile from someone he believed to be a Ukrainian arms dealer. However, it remains unclear whether this seller was in fact a Ukrainian citizen. Root also communicated with other illegal arms dealers in the US, as well as smugglers from Mexico who allegedly helped him escape the country after the attempt on Trump's life. According to court documents, Root had no links to the Ukrainian government or military leadership.

claims.text: Prince Harry Met with a Boy Injured in a Fire, Set by a Drunk Mother — Ukraine Tried to Pass Him Off as a War Victim

claimReview.title: Fake: Prince Harry Met with a Boy Injured in a Fire, Set by a Drunk Mother — Ukraine Tried to Pass Him Off as a War Victim
claimReview.textualRating: BBC News did not release such a story. The boy in the photo is named Roman Oleksiv — he received burns as a result of a Russian missile strike on Vinnytsia in 2022.

claims.text: Trump & Netanyahu are Planning on Resettling Gazans in Ukraine or Syria

claimReview.title: No, Trump & Netanyahu are Not Planning on Resettling Gazans in Ukraine or Syria

claims.text: Netanyahu recently announced plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria.

claimReview.title: Netanyahu Did Not Announce Plans to Relocate Gazans to Ukraine and Syria

claims.text: Ukrainian POW Forced to Sign Posthumous Organ Donation Consent by Commander

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian POW Forced to Sign Posthumous Organ Donation Consent by Commander
claimReview.textualRating: The document in the photo is a consent form for legal posthumous organ donation in the province of Ontario, Canada. Only Canadian citizens or those who have permanent residence, as well as state health insurance, can apply for donation. Most likely, the propagandists simply downloaded the form from the Internet.

claims.text: Ukrainian Ombudsman Calls on Sex Workers Abroad to Promote Pro-Ukrainian Ideas Among Clients

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian Ombudsman Calls on Sex Workers Abroad to Promote Pro-Ukrainian Ideas Among Clients
claimReview.textualRating: This video, like Kateryna Levchenko’s quote, is fabricated by propagandists.

claims.text: A Captured Ukrainian soldier did not know that he was carrying a consent form for an organ transplant, servicemen of the North military group told RIA Novosti

claimReview.title: Fact-check: Did Ukrainian Soldiers Sign Organ Harvesting Consent Forms Disguised as Medical Papers?

claims.text: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu Proposed to Resettle Gaza Residents to Ukraine and Syria

claimReview.title: Fake: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu Proposed to Resettle Gaza Residents to Ukraine and Syria
claimReview.textualRating: The statement about the proposal of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to resettle the population of Gaza to Ukraine and Syria is a fake.

claims.text: Ukrainians in Sweden Resort to Sex Work and Infect Local Residents with HIV

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainians in Sweden Resort to Sex Work and Infect Local Residents with HIV
claimReview.textualRating: In 2023, only 50 cases of HIV were recorded among Ukrainians in Sweden. The news about sex work, through which the infection is allegedly massively transmitted to locals, is fabricated.

claims.text: Ukraine Seeks to Buy Uranium from Niger to Develop Nuclear Weapons

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Seeks to Buy Uranium from Niger to Develop Nuclear Weapons
claimReview.textualRating: This claim, made by propagandists citing African media, is false - mainly because Defence Minister Rustem Umerov did not visit Niger in November 2023. Moreover, by the end of 2024, the French company Orano had lost control of uranium mining in Niger, and the country's main uranium buyers are now Russia and China.

claims.text: BBC Labels Valerii Zaluzhnyi 'Next President of Ukraine'

claimReview.title: Fake: BBC Labels Valerii Zaluzhnyi 'Next President of Ukraine'
claimReview.textualRating: The claim that BBC News labelled a photo of Ukraine's Ambassador to the UK, Valerii Zaluzhnyi, as the "next president of Ukraine" is unfounded and constitutes disinformation. The screenshot, purportedly taken from a BBC News broadcast, has been faked.

claims.text: Ukrainian Soldier Admits that Ukrainian Forces ‘Killed Children in Sudzha’

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian Soldier Admits that Ukrainian Forces ‘Killed Children in Sudzha’
claimReview.textualRating: The claim circulating on Russian platforms that a Ukrainian soldier allegedly confessed to killing a child near Sudzha is either fake or at least unverified. The message was posted on a Facebook account that, according to available data, previously belonged to Ukrainian soldier Artur Yakovitskyi. His family has reported him missing - according to open sources, he disappeared near the settlement of Sudzha on 28 February 2025. On 28 March, a suspicious post appeared on his Facebook page, allegedly containing a confession to the murder. On 1 April, a screenshot of this post began actively circulating on pro-Russian Telegram channels. The image of the "murdered teenager" attached to the post was likely generated by artificial intelligence - this is supported by the analysis results of several AI detection tools.

claims.text: A UK regional newspaper says 70,000 Ukrainian Soldiers died in Kursk.

claimReview.title: Fake front page Ukraine story linked to Russian disinformation
claimReview.textualRating: False. The newspaper front page is fake.

claims.text: Ukraine's Presidential Office Claims EU ‘Owes’ Ukraine for Security

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine's Presidential Office Claims EU ‘Owes’ Ukraine for Security
claimReview.textualRating: The propagandists fabricated a screenshot of a Ukrainian news article with a quote purporting to be from Mykhailo Podolyak, an adviser to the head of the Ukrainian presidential administration, saying that EU countries 'owe' Ukraine for security. In reality, Podolyak said that each country independently determines the amount of military assistance Ukraine can expect.

claims.text: A post shared on Facebook claims to show a Charlie Hebdo magazine cover of Ukrainian President Volodoymr Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: Charlie Hebdo Magazine Cover Of Zelenskyy Is Fake

claims.text: France Refused to Provide CIA with Information on Ukrainian Corrupt Officials — Euronews

claimReview.title: Fake: France Refused to Provide CIA with Information on Ukrainian Corrupt Officials — Euronews
claimReview.textualRating: Neither Euronews nor any other trustworthy source has reported such an incident.

claims.text: Ukraine 'Violated Obligation to Maintain Energy Ceasefire'

claimReview.title: Manipulation: Ukraine 'Violated Obligation to Maintain Energy Ceasefire'
claimReview.textualRating: Russia itself has not stopped attacking Ukraine's energy and civilian infrastructure for a single day - neither after Zelenskyy's promise to stop such attacks, nor after Putin's conversation with Donald Trump, during which the Russian leader supposedly ordered a halt to attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities. After the alleged 'agreement to stop strikes', Russia continues to launch more than a hundred attack drones into Ukraine every day, targeting energy facilities, among other targets. The most massive attacks after the agreement between Putin and Trump were Russian strikes on the regions of Kropyvnytskyi, Odesa, Zaporizhzhya, Donetsk, Sumy and Kyiv regions.

claims.text: Mark Rubio threatens to 'cut off Ukraine's Starlink access.'

claimReview.title: No, Rubio didn't threaten to cut off Ukraine's Starlink access

claims.text: Russia Shot Down Its Own Drones Over Ukraine After Trump's Conversation with Putin

claimReview.title: Fake: Russia Shot Down Its Own Drones Over Ukraine After Trump's Conversation with Putin
claimReview.textualRating: Despite the unsubstantiated statements of the Russian Defenсe Ministry, Russia continued shelling Ukraine even after the US President talked on the phone with the Kremlin leader. Energy infrastructure in the Donetsk and Dnipropetrovsk regions was shelled. In total on the night of March 18-19, 2025, 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles and four S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles, as well as 145 Shahed strike UAVs were launched over Ukraine.

claims.text: A post shared on Facebook claims that European leaders took off their suit jackets in support of Ukraine.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, European Leaders Didn’t Take Off Suit Jackets In Support Of Ukraine

claims.text: A post shared on X claims a British outlet reported 70,000 Ukrainian troops died in Kursk.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, Outlet Did Not Report 70,000 Ukrainian Troops Died In Kursk

claims.text: This image shows an authentic headline by Hull Daily Mail that reads, "70,000 Ukrainian soldiers in the Kursk region died in vain," from March 13, 2025.

claimReview.title: Fake Hull Daily Mail headline about Ukrainian casualties

claims.text: InfoWars Journalist Murdered Shortly After Ukraine 'Put Him On Their Kill List'

claimReview.title: Fake: InfoWars Journalist Murdered Shortly After Ukraine 'Put Him On Their Kill List'
claimReview.textualRating: The journalist was not on Ukraine's so-called kill list or in the Myrotvorets database. His sister and local police believe that his death was unrelated to his journalistic activities.

claims.text: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and a journalist had an exchange about the impending peace talks between Ukraine and Russia.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: Exchange between U.S. defense official and journalist on Ukraine-Russia FAKE

claims.text: Image shows a transcript of the White House meeting between US president Donald Trump, vice-president JD Vance and Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Fake Transcript Of Fiery Trump-Zelenskyy Exchange In Oval Office Goes Viral

claims.text: The Ukrainian parliament is preparing to pass a new bill making 14yo eligible for mobilisation.

claimReview.title: The Ukrainian parliament is NOT preparing to pass a new bill making 14-year-olds eligible for mobilization or registration

claims.text: Pro-Ukrainian Rallies in the US Organized by Criminal Gangs

claimReview.title: Fake: Pro-Ukrainian Rallies in the US Organized by Criminal Gangs
claimReview.textualRating: There is no proof of this. Neither Donald Trump nor anyone from his administration made such statements.

claims.text: Ukraine Launched a Massive Bot Attack on YouTube

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Launched a Massive Bot Attack on YouTube
claimReview.textualRating: Wired has never published such claims, and the video itself was probably created using AI. The fake is noticeably different from the outlet's official style: it lacks the characteristic title, and the footage used is of poor quality. StopFake's journalists found no evidence of such a bot campaign; instead, they discovered that after Zelensky's meeting with Trump, Russian propaganda stepped up the spread of deepfakes, doctored screenshots, and fake videos bearing the logos of well-known media outlets to sow dissension among Ukraine's allies and demoralise Ukrainian society.

claims.text: purports to show a Ukrainian flag being raised on the Statue of Liberty

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, The Ukrainian Flag Was Not Raised On The Statue Of Liberty

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing bombs, claiming he was signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza.

claimReview.title: This Image Does Not Show Zelenskyy Signing Bombs for Gaza

claims.text: Europe's aid to Ukraine "was in the form of a loan. They get their money back and we didn't."

claimReview.title: Trump Exaggerates on U.S. and European Aid to Ukraine, Loans

claims.text: Ukraine Stopped Using the Starlink System and Insulted Elon Musk — UNITED24

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Stopped Using the Starlink System and Insulted Elon Musk — UNITED24
claimReview.textualRating: UNITED24 did not report such information, and neither did any other credible source.

claims.text: WSJ Reports That US Has Refused to Pay for Stay of Ukrainian Delegation

claimReview.title: Fake: WSJ Reports That US Has Refused to Pay for Stay of Ukrainian Delegation
claimReview.textualRating: This information is fake, as the Wall Street Journal never published such an article, and the screenshot circulating online is a fake.

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy wore a suit in a meeting with Karl Schwab World Economic Forum executive chairman

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Zelenskyy Did NOT Wear Suit In Meeting With Klaus Schwab After February 2025 White House Visit

claims.text: "The Ukrainian Maidan ... for most Georgians has become a symbol of the destruction of a nation."

claimReview.title: Georgian speaker misleads on Georgians’ support for Ukraine

claims.text: Volodymyr Zelenskiy has blocked access to Trump's Truth Social across Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Truth Social ban falsehood pushed by Russian media
claimReview.textualRating: False. Truth Social has never been available in Ukraine.

claims.text: The US is “in for $300 billion plus” in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Trump and Starmer's White House talks: fact checked – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s not clear what this figure is based on and we’ve not seen any evidence to support it. Other estimates for the total amount of aid the US has committed to Ukraine are significantly lower.

claims.text: Europe will get back the money it has given to Ukraine, while the US will not.

claimReview.title: Trump and Starmer's White House talks: fact checked – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The US and Europe have both provided Ukraine with a mixture of loans and grants, so neither can expect all the money to be returned.

claims.text: Zelenskyy blocked access to Truth Social in Ukraine

claimReview.title: Truth Social never became available in Ukraine | Fact check

claims.text: “It is important to emphasize that Russia possesses significantly — I want to stress this — significantly larger resources of this kind than Ukraine. Our historical territories that have become part of the Russian Federation again also hold certain reserves. We are ready to work there with international partners, including Americans.”

claimReview.title: Putin baselessly offers Ukraine’s rare earth minerals as Russian commodity

claims.text: The United States forced Russia to invade Ukraine

claimReview.title: Is it true that the U.S. forced Russia to invade Ukraine, according to Pheidias Panayiotou?

claims.text: Donald Trump Jr. stated that he did not understand why anyone would choose Ukraine as an ally over Russia on his Triggered podcast.

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Donald Trump Jr. Did NOT Say On His Podcast That US 'Should Have Been Sending Weapons To Russia' -- Audio Is Likely AI Generated

claims.text: "Zelenskyy said he would quickly make peace with Russia, but instead, he started a war."

claimReview.title: Russia’s UK ambassador falsely claims Zelenskyy started Russia-Ukraine war

claims.text: German Foreign Minister Baerbock threatens US with severing ties amid Trump's comments on Zelensky and Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Germany Has Not Threatened To Cut Ties With the U.S. After Talks With Russia

claims.text: This is how ethnic minorities are treated in Ukraine. Legacy Media will never show you this daily occurrence because it doesn’t suit their narrative.

claimReview.title: Youturn | fact check

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Did Ukraine "Psychological Warfare" unit get $140M from USAID?

claims.text: Donald Trump just said that Ukraine started the war.

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Donald Trump DID Say Ukraine Started War

claims.text: The U.S. has given Ukraine “$350 billion” for the war with Russia gave “$200 billion more than Europe.”

claimReview.title: Trump's False and Misleading Ukraine Claims

claims.text: A post shared on Facebook claims Ukrainian President Volodomyr Zelenskyy bought deceased genocidal Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler's home, the Eagle's Nest.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, Zelenskyy Didn’t Buy Hitler’s Eagle’s Nest Home

claims.text: Trump's Press Secretary Says Germany Belongs in 'The Dock' for Supporting Ukraine

claimReview.title: Fake: Trump's Press Secretary Says Germany Belongs in 'The Dock' for Supporting Ukraine
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence that Karoline Leavitt actually published such a post.

claims.text: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz declared a state of emergency in Germany due to Trump's peace plan for Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Germany’s Olaf Scholz Has Not Declared a State of Emergency Over Trump’s Ukraine Plan

claims.text: Trump says USA spent $350 billion in Ukraine

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Did the US give $350B to Ukraine, as Trump claims?

claims.text: Ukraine ‘should have never started it’Russia Ukraine WarUKRAINE-CRISIS/WHAT TRUMP SAID

claimReview.title: Trump says Ukraine started the war that's killing its citizens. What are the facts?
claimReview.textualRating: Russia’s army crossed the border on Feb

claims.text: Ukraine 'Attacked IAEA Officials with Drones and Artillery'

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine 'Attacked IAEA Officials with Drones and Artillery'
claimReview.textualRating: Verified geolocation data confirms that during the movement of IAEA personnel to the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP), Russian strike systems were active in the area, particularly near the settlement of Kamianske. In addition, Russian forces conducted offensive operations in this area despite written guarantees to the IAEA by both sides of the conflict on 12 February 2025 to ensure the safety of this route. No activity from Ukrainian strike systems was recorded on the day of the rotation of IAEA representatives.

claims.text: A photo shows President Volodymyr Zelenskyy recently wearing a suit to meet WEF founder Klaus Schwab because he is his “actual boss”, amid criticism Mr Zelenskyy received for not wearing one to meet President Trump.

claimReview.title: Photo of Zelenskyy wearing a suit when meeting WEF leader ...
claimReview.textualRating: This photo shows the two men in suits in 2020, before Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, after which President Zelenskyy stopped wearing suits publicly.

claims.text: Zelenskyy offered in a February 1 interview evidence of misappropriation of US aid for Ukraine, corruption and abuse of power

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Zelenskyy's Statements In February 2025 Interview Do NOT Prove He Embezzled US Aid For Ukraine Worth $100 Billion

claims.text: After USAID Freezes Funding for Ukrainian Fact-Checking Organizations, the Number of Fakes Decreased by 12 Times — Microsoft

claimReview.title: Fake: After USAID Freezes Funding for Ukrainian Fact-Checking Organizations, the Number of Fakes Decreased by 12 Times — Microsoft
claimReview.textualRating: Microsoft did not release such a video. The quote from journalist Dhruv Mehrotra, given in the video, is also fabricated.

claims.text: President Trump: I have reached an agreement with Putin to end the war in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Trump and Putin Have Not Reached an Agreement to End Russia-Ukraine War

claims.text: Ukraine 'Attacked Chornobyl NPP Sarcophagus to Blame Russia'

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine 'Attacked Chornobyl NPP Sarcophagus to Blame Russia'
claimReview.textualRating: The Russian drone named "Geran-2", a Shahed-type UAV, attacked the shelter over the fourth reactor of the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant (ChNPP) on the night of 14 February 2025. This is confirmed by photographic and video evidence showing the engine and other parts of the drone found at the impact site, which are specific to a Russian UAV. Representatives of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) present at the site also confirmed the attack on the sarcophagus. In addition, independent open-source intelligence (OSINT) analysts confirmed that the drone entered Ukrainian airspace from the north or north-east, coming from Russian or Belarusian territory. Since the start of its full-scale war against Ukraine, Russia has consistently used attacks on Ukrainian nuclear energy facilities as a weapon and tool of blackmail to achieve its geopolitical objectives.

claims.text: Trump says Russia has lost 1.5 million troops In Ukraine war

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Trump Says Russia Has Lost 1.5 Million Troops In Ukraine War

claims.text: Metropolitan Epiphanius in Washington Called to Return Nuclear Weapons to Ukraine

claimReview.title: Manipulation: Metropolitan Epiphanius in Washington Called to Return Nuclear Weapons to Ukraine
claimReview.textualRating: Metropolitan Epiphanius did not say anything like that. He only mentioned nuclear weapons in the context of Ukraine giving up its own arsenal in exchange for security guarantees.

claims.text: Ukraine is selling half of the armaments it receives from the United States

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Are Ukrainian Weapons Being Sold on Black Market?

claims.text: "Ukraine remains the only source of security threats to the ZNPP as it routinely targets the nuclear facility and its critical infrastructure, as well as the satellite city of Energodar…"

claimReview.title: Russia pins nuclear threat on Ukraine after militarizing atomic power station

claims.text: A post shared on X claims E! News reported that United States Agency Aid and Development (USAID) paid millions for celebrities to visit Ukraine.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, E! News Did Not Report USAID Paid Celebrities Millions To Visit Ukraine

claims.text: Ukraine Selling American Weapons to Cartels

claimReview.title: Russian Propaganda by Tucker Carlson on Ukraine Selling Weapons to Drug Cartels

claims.text: 90% of Ukraine's Media Were Totally Dependent on USAID

claimReview.title: Manipulation: 90% of Ukraine's Media Were Totally Dependent on USAID
claimReview.textualRating: The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) has indeed funded a significant portion of Ukrainian media. However, the exact degree of dependence varied from outlet to outlet: some grants accounted for up to 100% of a media organization's budget, while others were much smaller. Moreover, Ukrainian media receive support not only from USAID, but also from the European Union, the United Nations, and various other countries, foundations, and organizations.

claims.text: USAID Funded Hollywood Celebrities' Visits to Ukraine During War - E!News

claimReview.title: Fake: USAID Funded Hollywood Celebrities' Visits to Ukraine During War - E!News
claimReview.textualRating: The E!News portal never published such a story, and the widely circulated news is fake, debunked by both the media and the celebrities who visited Ukraine.

claims.text: “In the heat of candor, the leader of the Bandera regime admitted that he and his comrades had embezzled $100 billion.”

claimReview.title: False: Russian allegations that Ukraine ‘stole’ $100 billion of US funds

claims.text: Keir Starmer has promised Ukraine £3 billion a year for the next 100 years.

claimReview.title: Has the UK promised to give Ukraine £3 billion a year for the next 100 years? – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not really correct. The UK has signed a 100-year partnership accord with Ukraine, but it doesn’t commit the UK to providing military aid for 100 years. It says the UK will give £3 billion a year of military support until 2030/31 and “for as long as needed to support Ukraine”.

claims.text: USAID Funded Biolabs in Ukraine – Bloomberg

claimReview.title: Fake: USAID Funded Biolabs in Ukraine – Bloomberg
claimReview.textualRating: The «news» story circulating online is fabricated to discredit USAID. Bloomberg has not published such stories on its website or social networks. General Brown Jr. has also not made such statements.

claims.text: Ben Stiller received $4 million from USAID for his photographs with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

claimReview.title: Ben Stiller Denies USAID Funding Claims for Ukraine Trip

claims.text: E! News reported USAID paid celebrities to visit Ukraine

claimReview.title: Fact Check: E! News Did NOT Report Ben Stiller, Angelina Jolie, Sean Penn And Other Celebrities Were Paid By USAID To Visit Ukraine

claims.text: claims Trump purportedly criticized British PM Keir Starmer over a 100-year deal between the U.K. and Ukraine

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, Donald Trump Did Not Criticize Keir Starmer Over A 100-Year Deal Between The UK And Ukraine

claims.text: Russia Won 70% of Ukraine 's Mineral Wealth - Forbes

claimReview.title: Fake: Russia Won 70% of Ukraine 's Mineral Wealth - Forbes
claimReview.textualRating: Russia does not control 70% of Ukraine's mineral resources. Propaganda distorted the Forbes magazine article, claiming control over the territories where, according to the website, a significant amount of Ukraine's mineral resources with the highest total value are located.

claims.text: “The president of Ukraine, even under conditions of martial law, has no right to extend his powers. ... If we start negotiations now, they will be illegitimate.”

claimReview.title: Amid Trump’s call for peace in Ukraine, Putin falsely frames talks with Zelenskyy as ‘illegitimate’

claims.text: Zelenskyy "went to Pennsylvania and campaigned for the opposition in October."

claimReview.title: Trump, Vance and Zelenskyy's tense Oval Office meeting about ...

claims.text: Tariffs are paid for by the country they are imposed on.

claimReview.title: Trump and Starmer's White House talks: fact checked – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Tariffs are actually paid by companies that import goods—so any tariffs imposed by the US would be paid for by US companies. Where the burden of the tariffs ultimately falls is uncertain, and can vary.

claims.text: Mr Trump’s second UK state visit is unprecedented.

claimReview.title: Trump and Starmer's White House talks: fact checked – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is true—Mr Trump will be the first elected head of state to receive a second state visit.

claims.text: The EU has placed tariffs on the US in the form of VAT.

claimReview.title: Trump and Starmer's White House talks: fact checked – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Value-added tax is a tax on domestic consumption, so is levied regardless of where goods were produced. It is not typically regarded as a tariff.

claims.text: Soldier of the 22nd Separate Mechanized Brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine who, during vacation, beat his father to death.

claimReview.title: Debunking Russian fakes. No, soldier of Ukraine’s 22nd Mechanized Brigade didn’t beat his father to death – Gwara Media
claimReview.textualRating: Fake. The article the authors refer to was heavily edited on the screenshot. Its original on "Dumka," Kharkiv media outlet, doesn't mention anything about the accused being a soldier of the Armed Forces or having PTSD. The Prosecutor's Office also doesn't mention anything about the accused being from the military. Official social media channels of 22nd brigade confirm that the mentioned men weren't serving in their brigade.

claims.text: Trump stopped all aid to Ukraine, including military aid

claimReview.title: No, "all US aid to Ukraine" isn't paused because of Trump’s order – Gwara Media
claimReview.textualRating: Trump's order doesn't pause military aid to foreign countries, including Ukraine. It establishes a 90-day pause in US foreign aid that applies to the United States’ foreign development assistance, meaning programs aimed at financing humanitarian aid, economic development, medicine, education, and so on for other countries.

claims.text: An audio recording features Donald Trump criticising Keir Starmer over aid to Ukraine, taxes and energy.

claimReview.title: Audio of President Trump criticising Keir Starmer is fake – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This audio isn’t real. It was generated using AI. The video includes sped-up footage from an interview the podcaster Theo Von did with the president in August 2024.

claims.text: "Ukraine was gradually turning into a testing ground for experiments of any quality with biolabs, obviously with organ trading."

claimReview.title: Russia weds biolab, organ harvesting conspiracies to discredit US, Ukraine

claims.text: USAID Responsible for Destroying Moscow Patriarchate of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church

claimReview.title: Fake: USAID Responsible for Destroying Moscow Patriarchate of the ...
claimReview.textualRating: This is another disinformation narrative about USAID’s activities and religious freedom in Ukraine. The agency made no attempt to influence the attitude of Ukrainians towards the Moscow Patriarchate of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church, nor did it finance projects that could contribute to this.

claims.text: “On top of this, Zelenskyy admits that half of the money we sent him is ‘MISSING.’”

claimReview.title: Trump’s flurry of false claims about Ukraine

claims.text: Zelensky is “down at 4 percent approval rating.”

claimReview.title: Trump’s flurry of false claims about Ukraine

claims.text: “Zelenskyy talked the United States of America into spending $350 Billion Dollars, to go into a War that couldn’t be won. … The United States has spent $200 Billion Dollars more than Europe.”

claimReview.title: Trump’s flurry of false claims about Ukraine

claims.text: Donald Trump alleged Volodymyr Zelensky has low approval ratings

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Does Zelensky Have a 4% Approval Rating?

claims.text: Florida Governor Mocks Ukrainian Oligarch Who Donated to LA Fire Victims

claimReview.title: Fake: Florida Governor Mocks Ukrainian Oligarch Who Donated to LA Fire Victims
claimReview.textualRating: This news is completely false: there is no evidence that Yuriy Kosiuk actually donated this money to the victims, and Ron DeSantis did not comment on this fabricated story.

claims.text: "Volodymyr Zelenskyy, once again, called for the occupation of Ukraine by Western troops.”

claimReview.title: False: Zelenskyy called for Western occupation of Ukraine

claims.text: The US has massively halted arms shipments to Ukraine. The United States has withdrawn all applications for the transit of goods in the interests of Ukraine through Rzeszow, Constanta and Varna.

claimReview.title: The US has NOT halted arms shipments to Ukraine as of January 21, 2025

claims.text: Ukraine Bans Criticism of Government in Comments

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Bans Criticism of Government in Comments
claimReview.textualRating: There are no provisions in Ukrainian law that prohibit citizens from criticizing the authorities, including in comments on social media or other online platforms. The new draft law protects media outlets from being held liable for the actions of users, but does not introduce censorship. Instead, it clarifies existing obligations regarding content moderation.

claims.text: Ukrainian Scammers Bilk $40 Million from Los Angeles Fire Victims - USA Today

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian Scammers Bilk $40 Million from Los Angeles Fire Victims - USA Today
claimReview.textualRating: This is fake, because the information about "Ukrainian phone scammers" was not published on the official platforms of USA Today, and the video with the logo of the outlet turned out to be fake and was spread by propagandists through Telegram. In addition, the Los Angeles Police Department has not reported any such scams involving Ukrainians.

claims.text: Firefighting Trucks Previously Supplied by US to Ukraine Found in Gaza – Times of Israel

claimReview.title: Fake: Firefighting Trucks Previously Supplied by US to Ukraine Found in Gaza – Times of Israel
claimReview.textualRating: The news circulating online is fabricated, and the story of the discovered pickup trucks is completely fictitious. The Times of Israel has not published any such reports on its website or social media platforms.

claims.text: "00,000,000 The amount of aid flowing in from Ukraine, Israel, Europe, Mexico and Canada to help" battle wildfires in California.

claimReview.title: Canada and Mexico Are Helping to Fight California Fires, Contrary to Meme

claims.text: A post shared on X claims eight mansions belonging to Ukrainian military officials burned down in Los Angeles, California.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, Eight Mansions Belonging To Ukrainian Military Officials Did Not Burn Down In LA

claims.text: U.S. uses forced labor by involving inmates in fighting Los Angeles fires, while sanctioning China for using forced labor in Xinjiang.

claimReview.title: Russia exploits wildfires in Los Angeles to push anti-US, anti-Ukraine propaganda

claims.text: Police Questioned Ukrainians Who Celebrated Christmas on January 7

claimReview.title: Fake: Police Questioned Ukrainians Who Celebrated Christmas on January 7
claimReview.textualRating: The claim that Ukrainians who celebrate Christmas on January 7 have been questioned by the police is a fabrication. It is perfectly legal to celebrate Christmas on January 7th in Ukraine. There is no evidence that such a sign has actually been posted in any church in the country, nor that police have interrogated worshippers in church.

claims.text: "Biden is giving $770 to victims of the fires. He gave $500 million to Ukraine last week."

claimReview.title: $770 Payments Are Just One Form of Federal Aid to L.A. Fire Victims

claims.text: Ukrainian Student in New York Complains about Black Classmates and Believes Her Education Should Be Covered by Taxpayers

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian Student in New York Complains about Black Classmates and Believes Her Education Should Be Covered by Taxpayers
claimReview.textualRating: The propagandists used footage from a real Voice of America report about Ukrainian students in the United States. However, the part where the girl talks about black classmates selling drugs and claims that she has the right to study for free was generated using AI.

claims.text: Poland Estimated Ukrainian Population at Less than 15 Million

claimReview.title: Fake: Poland Estimated Ukrainian Population at Less than 15 Million
claimReview.textualRating: Poland did not make any calculations suggesting that only 15 million citizens remain in Ukraine. Nor was it reported that 9.5 million people had moved to Russia. Propaganda fabricated these figures and attributed them to the Polish publication Wiadomosci to support a disinformation narrative claiming that Ukraine's population has shrunk significantly and that Ukrainians fleeing the country prefer Russia to EU countries.

claims.text: The Ukrainian government said eight mansions owned by military officials were destroyed in LA wildfires

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Ukrainian Govt Did NOT Say 'Eight Mansions Owned By Ukrainian Military Officials' Burned In Los Angeles Wildfires As Of January 13, 2025

claims.text: 8 mansions of high-ranking Ukrainian military burned down in Los Angeles.

claimReview.title: Russian Propaganda: 8 Mansions of High-Ranking Ukrainian Military Officials Did NOT Burn Down in Los Angeles

claims.text: Eight Villas Belonging to Ukrainian Generals Burned Down in Los Angeles

claimReview.title: Fake: Eight Villas Belonging to Ukrainian Generals Burned Down in Los Angeles
claimReview.textualRating: This «news» is a fabrication, and the video circulating online is fake. Neither United24 nor any other credible source published such information.

claims.text: Los Angeles firefighting equipment donation to Ukraine is responsible for not putting out the fires in California.

claimReview.title: The donation of firefighting equipment to Ukraine is NOT responsible for the difficulties in extinguishing the fires in California

claims.text: Ukrainian Diaspora in Canada Called for a Referendum on Joining US

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian Diaspora in Canada Called for a Referendum on Joining US
claimReview.textualRating: The news was published by a «satirical» pro-Russian channel that constantly spreads fakes about Ukraine. No diaspora organization in Canada has made such statements, and «Steve Tkachuk,» whom propagandists called the head of the Ukrainian Association in Toronto, does not exist at all.

claims.text: Did California Donate Firefighting Equipment to Ukraine?

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Did California Donate Firefighting Equipment to Ukraine?

claims.text: Los Angeles Fires Can Not Be Put Out Because Local Fire Department Gave Ukraine Surplus Equipment

claimReview.title: Fake: Los Angeles Fires Can Not Be Put Out Because Local Fire Department Gave Ukraine Surplus Equipment
claimReview.textualRating: The Los Angeles Fire Department made a small donation of unusable equipment back in March 2022. It contained helmets, gloves, boots, medicines — not the powerful machinery needed to fight a fire of this scale.

claims.text: A post shared on Threads claims to show Ukraine releasing a list of politicians, such as President Joe Biden, taking bribes.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, Ukraine Didn’t Release List Of Politicians Taking Bribes

claims.text: During Volodymyr Zelensky's New Year Speech, Mother Ukraine Monument was Illuminated in US Flag Colors

claimReview.title: Manipulation: During Volodymyr Zelensky's New Year Speech, Mother Ukraine Monument was Illuminated in US Flag Colors
claimReview.textualRating: The main part of President Zelensky's speech took place against the backdrop of the Mother Ukraine monument, which was illuminated in the colors of the Ukrainian flag. The monument was lit in the colors of flags of other countries when the President spoke about Ukraine's allies during the war, including the United States.

claims.text: Ukrainians published a photo from 2022 to depict the... North Korean "prisoner."

claimReview.title: Ukrainians DID NOT publish a 2022 photo to depict their first North Korean prisoner

claims.text: "It was Igor Kirillov who exposed the American biological laboratories in Ukraine that developed biological agents for selectively targeting people belonging to specific ethnic groups, including Slavs."

claimReview.title: Moscow leverages killing of Russian general to spread conspiracy theories

claims.text: American Hosts Laugh After Report on Ukrainian Army Losses

claimReview.title: Fake: American Hosts Laugh After Report on Ukrainian Army Losses
claimReview.textualRating: This is fake because the video has been edited: the propagandists used an archival broadcast from the American KMAX 31 station from 2019, replacing the on-screen text and adding footage of a Ukrainian cemetery. The original clip shows a blooper involving an anchor that has nothing to do with news about Ukraine or the Pentagon.

claims.text: "[T]he figures announced with regard to losses on both sides, it is obvious that they were presented in the Ukrainian interpretation … Ukraine’s losses are multiple times higher than those of Russia.”

claimReview.title: Kremlin falsely claims Trump’s report of 600,000 Russian casualties in Ukraine came from Kyiv

claims.text: An image shows mobile morgues delivered by Coca-Cola to store the bodies of Ukrainian soldiers.

claimReview.title: Russian websites spread altered image of Coca-Cola boilers in ...
claimReview.textualRating: The image has been manipulated by pro-Russian websites and does not show morgues.

claims.text: European Parliament applauding decision to allow Ukraine to use US missiles

claimReview.title: Parliament didn't applaud Ukraine's use of US missiles | Fact check

claims.text: Canadian Lieutenant Colonel Kent Miller was killed by a Russian strike in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Russian Disinformation Campaign on the Alleged Death of a ...

claims.text: Pentagon Declares Ukraine One of the Most Corrupt Countries

claimReview.title: Manipulation: Pentagon Declares Ukraine One of the Most Corrupt ...
claimReview.textualRating: The report by the U.S. Department of Defense Inspector General does indeed highlight some of the challenges Ukraine faces in its anti-corruption reforms. Overall, however, the document praises Ukraine's efforts to reform its institutions.

claims.text: Ukrainians Have Become Leaders in Migrant Crime in Germany

claimReview.title: Manipulation: Ukrainians Have Become Leaders in Migrant Crime in Germany
claimReview.textualRating: This claim is not true. The largest group of migrants suspected of crimes are individuals from Syria (19.2% of all migrant suspects). Ukrainians accounted for only 11.6% of suspects in 2023. This figure is significantly lower than their share of all refugees living in Germany (33.1%).

claims.text: Valerii Zaluzhnyi Told Ukrainian Soldiers Not to Fear Death Because They Have No Chance of Survival — The Sun

claimReview.title: Manipulation: Valerii Zaluzhnyi Told Ukrainian Soldiers Not to Fear Death Because They Have No Chance of Survival — The Sun
claimReview.textualRating: The quote from Valerii Zaluzhnyi's speech to Ukrainian soldiers being trained in the UK was taken out of context. The former commander-in-chief of Ukraine's armed forces did not claim that Ukrainian soldiers "have no chance of survival." While General Zaluzhnyi did encourage soldiers not to fear death, he emphasized that "war will be afraid of those that are ready to join it." He also stressed the importance of practical skills, experience, courage, and mutual support among comrades for successful combat operations.

claims.text: Coca-Cola Donates Mobile Morgues to Ukraine as Humanitarian Aid

claimReview.title: Fake: Coca-Cola Donates Mobile Morgues to Ukraine as ...
claimReview.textualRating: In reality, the photo shared by the company on its Instagram page shows mobile boiler rooms for heating.

claims.text: After Trump's Election Victory, Ukrainian Military Surrendered More Often, Says ISW

claimReview.title: Fake: After Trump's Election Victory, Ukrainian Military Surrendered More Often, Says ISW
claimReview.textualRating: The Institute for the Study of War did not release this video or report such observations.

claims.text: A post shared on Facebook claims billionaire Elon Musk posted a "last dollar" for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: Elon Musk Didn’t Post ‘Last Dollar’ For Zelenskyy

claims.text: “[W]e have always recognized the borders of Ukraine within the framework of our agreements after the collapse of the Soviet Union. … But later, as is known, the Ukrainian leadership amended the Basic Law and announced its desire to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, and we did not agree to this.”

claimReview.title: Putin justifies war in Ukraine by accusing Kyiv of violating a treaty Moscow violated repeatedly

claims.text: Two Colombians Fighting in the Ukrainian Military Desert Positions

claimReview.title: Fake: Two Colombians Fighting in the Ukrainian Military Desert ...
claimReview.textualRating: The National Police Main Directorate in the Kharkiv region refuted this information.

claims.text: Ukrainian Water Bodies Contaminated Due to the Rapid Growth of Cemeteries — Greenpeace

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian Water Bodies Contaminated Due to the Rapid ...
claimReview.textualRating: Greenpeace did not release such a study, and the term «cadaveric poison» itself is considered outdated and rarely used in modern science.

claims.text: "[T]here are no means of countering such weapons [hypersonic ballistic missile Oreshnik] today. … It is impossible."

claimReview.title: Putin claims new Oreshnik missile is unstoppable, sparking doubts

claims.text: South Korea is sending troops to Ukraine in response to North Korea's troops supporting Russia

claimReview.title: Fact Check: South Korea Did NOT Announce It Will Send Its Troops To Ukraine 'To Fight' North Korean Soldiers Supporting Russia, As Of October 30, 2024

claims.text: "…it was not Russia's actions that precipitated the escalation in Ukraine, but rather the 2014 coup d’etat, supported primarily by the United States. It was even publicly disclosed how much financial support the then U.S. administration allocated toward preparing and orchestrating this coup.”

claimReview.title: Putin claims, falsely, US, not Russia, escalated situation in Ukraine

claims.text: This picture shows Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy refusing to shake hands with the UN Secretary-General António Guterres.

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Did Zelenskyy refuse to shake hands with UN Secretary-General?

claims.text: “[Ukrainians] are ruthlessly pushed by their own authorities to the war to be slaughtered there.”

claims.text: “The Washington Post writes, citing an anonymous top Ukrainian official that the number of [Ukrainians] ready to make territorial concessions to resolve the conflict is growing. The number of people dissatisfied with the actions of Western allies is also growing.”

claimReview.title: Russian tabloid distorts Washington Post report on Ukraine to fit Kremlin propaganda narratives

claims.text: “We can send BILLIONS to Ukraine but Americans who have lost everything only get $750 dollars?!”

claimReview.title: Posts Misrepresent Federal Response, Funding for Hurricane Helene Victims

claims.text: "$200 billion more to Ukraine. $2,500 per month to illegal aliens. $750 to Americans who lost everything in Hurricane Helene."

claimReview.title: Fact check: Viral claims on the Hurricane Helene disaster – DW – 10/08/2024

claims.text: The Russian Embassy in South Africa claimed in a Sept. 26 X post to show a downed Ukrainian F-16.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: Russian Embassy Shares Old Image Of F-16

claims.text: An image used in a meme is of a crashed F-16 belonging to the Ukrainian air force.

claimReview.title: Meme does not show crashed Ukrainian F-16 fighter jet – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is false. The image is of a US Air Force F-16 that crashed in California in 2019, and the Ukrainian coat of arms has been edited onto it.

claims.text: "Having analyzed the social media of the detained Ryan Routh, who attempted to assassinate Donald Trump, journalists came to the conclusion that representatives of the Kiev regime most likely involved him in recruiting foreigners, including from Afghanistan, to replenish the brigades of the Armed Forces of Ukraine."

claimReview.title: Russia pushes baseless 'Ukraine ties' narrative in Trump ...

claims.text: Kinzhal missiles destroyed at least six Ukrainian F-16s

claimReview.title: No proof for the destruction of Ukrainian F-16s by Russian Kinzhal ...

claims.text: The most brutal Ukrainian units operating in the Kursk direction [in the Kursk region of Russia] are made up of mercenaries ... The mercenaries are the ones who are the most brutal towards civilians.

claimReview.title: Russian state media baselessly accuse Ukraine of cruelty to civilians in Kursk region

claims.text: A nuclear explosion occurred at an ammo depot in Tver, which was attacked by Ukrainians

claimReview.title: There were no nuclear explosions at the Russian ammo depot destroyed by Ukrainians

claimReview.title: Iran denies delivering ballistic missiles, aid to Moscow's Ukraine war ...

claims.text: A picture of the August issue of a British outlet, The Independent, has an ominous headline about a new mpox virus spreading in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Debunking Russian fakes. No, The Independent didn't write about Ukraine becoming center of monkeypox virus

claims.text: President Joe Biden "sent comrade [Vice President] Kamala [Harris] to see [Russian President Vladimir] Putin in Russia three days before the attack" on Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Trump's False Claim That Harris Met with Putin

claims.text: The Galaktika (shopping mall) is on fire. A huge number of people burned alive. Children. Women are screaming, hysterical, because their children are there. We saved as many people as we could, pulled them out. ...Vladimir Vladimirovich (Putin), …Ukraine needs to be taken over and everyone needs to be cleaned out.”

claimReview.title: A ‘huge number of people’ did not burn alive in the Donetsk shopping mall

claims.text: "Yet, more than two years into the Ukraine-Russia conflict, peace still appears distant, serving as an example that the coalition [NATO] is not promoting peace but rather threatening it."

claims.text: The Ukrainian president’s wife, Olena Zelenska, has purchased a brand new Bugatti for $4 million.

claimReview.title: President Zelenskyy’s wife did not spend $4 million on a Bugatti – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There is no evidence this is true. The car dealership it was supposedly purchased from has vehemently denied reports.
